title: 'Russian flag cannot be at Paris Olympics' says French President Macron
description: Despite the ongoing war, the IOC has recommended allowing athletes from Russia and Moscow ally Belarus to compete as individual neutrals in international competitions.

title: Daniil Medvedev beats the heat and Rublev to reach the US Open semifinals
description: Medvedev will play his fourth US Open semi in five years. In the women's tournament,  three semifinalists are already qualified: Sabalenka, Gauff and Muchova.

title: Africa calls for a global tax on carbon emissions
description: As the African Climate Summit ended, the heads of state adopted a joint declaration expressing their determination to make the continent a key player in the global energy transition.

title: In Mexico, the Supreme Court decriminalizes abortion nationwide
description: The decision comes amid a trend in Latin America of loosening restrictions on abortion, even as access has been limited in parts of the United States.

title: Rugby World Cup: Compare the strengths and weaknesses of the 20 teams
description: IN GRAPHS - Compare individual and collective statistics for each of the countries participating: ranking, age, experience, attack, defense, and more.

title: European Union begins battle to apply regulation of tech giants
description: On Wednesday, the European Commission designated Apple, Microsoft, Google, Amazon, Meta and ByteDance as companies concerned by the Digital Markets Act. They are showing general goodwill but also putting up resistance on certain points.

title: Paris-Berlin night train returns after nine years off the rails
description: The Austrian, French and German rail companies involved first announced plans to resurrect the service in December 2020.

title: Spanish footballer Hermoso files complaint over Rubiales' kiss
description: After Luis Rubiales forcibly kissed her when Spain won, Jenni Hermoso said the unwanted kiss had left her feeling 'vulnerable and like the victim of an assault.'

title: Rugby World Cup: France and New Zealand reveal their injury-hit starting lineups
description: Both French coach Fabien Galthié and his New Zealand counterpart Ian Foster revealed last-minute changes in their teams to play the opening game of this year's championship.

title: Paris art exhibit tackles childhood abuse
description: Works denouncing pedophilia have long frightened galleries and museums. The Galerie Marguerite Milin in Paris is now daring to take the plunge, exhibiting artists breaking the code of silence regarding sexual violence inflicted on children.

title: The Rolling Stones announce release date for their new album, unveil lead single 'Angry'
description: The Rolling Stones are back, and they're 'Angry.' At least that is the title of the debut single from the band's new album, the first in 18 years to contain a dozen original songs.

title: The ordeal of Tigrayan women in Ethiopia: 'Whether you shout or not, no one is going to come and rescue you'
description: At least 120,000 women were raped in Tigray during the war, according to Amnesty International. And almost a year after the peace agreement, the violence continues.

title: Russian mathematician arrested on new charges moments after prison release
description: Azat Miftakhov, who was sentenced in 2021 for attacking a United Russia office, was released from prison on Monday and immediately arrested again. Investigators accuse the anarchist activist of making remarks 'justifying terrorism' while in custody.

title: Afghanistan: UN's World Food Programme cuts aid to 2 million Afghans due to cash shortfall
description: The World Food Programme has had to cut off a total of 10 million people from its assistance this year. It is often the last lifeline for women, who are increasingly being pushed out of society and are struggling to feed their children.

title: Russian strike kills 16 in east Ukraine market, wounds dozens
description: Ukraine's prime minister said one child was among the dead.

title: 'Tensions between China and India around the G20 reflect a fragmentation of the international system'
description: Beijing and Delhi's underlying rivalry was already evident at the recent BRICS summit. And Xi Jinping's withdrawal from the upcoming G20 summit may be a further indication of the competition between the two Asian giants, writes columnist Sylvie Kauffmann.

title: José Sébéloué, tender voice of 80's French band La Compagnie Créole, has died
description: The singer from French Guiana, co-founder of the festive hit band, died in Paris on Sunday, aged 74.

title: Africa climate summit adopts 'Nairobi declaration'
description: The text is intended to define the shared position of the 54 countries of the African continent ahead of the next COP 28 in Dubai.

title: Ukraine: Rustem Umerov, the new defense minister at war with corruption
description: Umerov, who is of Crimea origin, will be tasked with introducing good governance into a ministry plagued by scandals, while the Ukraine's troops are engaged in a difficult counter-offensive.

title: Five little-known treasures for the whole family to discover at Paris's Jardin des Plantes
description: Four centuries old, the botanical garden, home to the Muséum National d'Histoire Naturelle and the Grande Galerie de l'Évolution, is a must-see for children, with its own mysteries and secret corners.

title: Macron takes to the field in southern French school, says sports creates 'tomorrow's champions'
description: On Tuesday, the French president visited Orthez in the Pyrenees, announcing additional sports fields and more hours spent doing sports at school.

title: Superconductors: US study suspected of fraud
description: In March, a team from the University of Rochester published a paper in 'Nature' on an alloy with promising properties. Since then, doubts have been growing about the reliability of the data and the integrity of its main co-author.

title: Northern Ireland police chief quits after damaging scandals
description: Simon Byrne was forced to resign as the head of the Police Service of Northern Ireland (PSNI) after a court ruled he had unlawfully disciplined two officers and a data breach. The PSNI, a key institution in the 1998 peace process, is in deep crisis.

title: UK's Labour Party leads Tories in polls, but risks being over-cautious
description: Polls suggest Labour could return to power in the UK's 2024 general election. Led by Keir Starmer, the main opposition is treading a cautious line, at the risk of alienating its members on the left.

title: France starts process of withdrawing its forces from Niger
description: Paris has discreetly opened discussions with the ruling military in Niamey on 'the withdrawal of certain elements,' after initially refusing to comply with the junta's demands. Some 1,500 soldiers are reportedly still deployed in the country.

title: US' Blinken visits Kyiv unannounced in show of support
description: The visit aims to assess Ukraine's three-month-old counteroffensive and signal continued support from Washington.

title: Muslim rights group appeals France's abaya ban in schools, bringing debate to highest court
description: The Action Droits des Musulmans (Action for the Rights of Muslims) organization filed an appeal after France banned the wearing of abayas and khamis in public schools. The country's highest administrative court heard the appeal on Tuesday.

title: Iran arrests Mahsa Amini uncle ahead of death anniversary
description: The young Iranian Kurdish woman died in custody and sparked months of protests. Her uncle, Safa Aeli, was arrested by security forces in the family's hometown of Saqez.

title: Rugby World Cup: 600,000 foreign tourists expected, and accommodation prices already soaring
description: The event, which runs from September 8 to October 28, has raised many expectations among the tourism industry.

title: Rugby World Cup takes place under tight security
description: Although the two events are not comparable, the Rugby World Cup will serve as a security trial run for the Paris Olympic Games, which take place nine months later.

title: Aviation industry faces scrutiny for environmental impact of contrails
description: Global scientists are closely studying the 'non-CO2' effects of air travel, notably the condensation trails left by planes, which create cloud cover that hinders the release of stored heat at night.

title: After the devastating 'Fire 344',  the future of Canada's boreal forest is uncertain
description: Over 6,068 fires have flared up in Canada since the beginning of May. More than 1,000 are still active, 686 of which are considered out of control. The province of Québec has been hardest hit, particularly in the north-western Abitibi-Témiscamingue region.

title: Le Monde in English now available on our mobile app
Russia's surging denunciation culture
description: Internet watchdog Roskomnadzor recorded 284,000 denunciation reports filed by Russian citizens in 2022, while a fraudulent mobile application glorifying the practice gained traction.

title: US Open: Novak Djokovic advances to a record 47th Grand Slam semi-final
description: Djokovic secured a 6-1, 6-4, 6-4 victory over Taylor Fritz, surpassing Roger Federer to claim the record for the most Grand Slam semi-finals reached by a male player.

title: Ursula von der Leyen announces a reassessment of the protection status of wolves in Europe
description: The president of the European Commission has announced a possible reassessment of the animal's protected species status, a 'political maneuver' according to environmentalists.

title: Rainstorms ravage Greece, Turkey and Bulgaria leaving at least 7 dead
description: Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis blamed both the storms on climate change while conceding that his center-right government 'clearly didn't manage things as well as we would have liked' on the wildfire front.
